intro: Helicteres biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered helicteres, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Helicteres biflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
